Posted By: vantha (1/31/2013 10:52:50 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
As long as Uncommon exists, there's no reason to get rid of Mythic Rarity. As long as we want Draft to be a format, there's no reason to have any problem with the current Rarity structure.  
  
  
However, I'm just saying that if we repealed Draft as a Format and made every card Common, Constructed would be a lot happier. :P  
  
Also this looks like it's got a [Sliver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sliver) head. :)  
  
I'm going to have a LOT to say about various Sliver artworks for M14, but ultimately- it makes a big difference whether you've got a FACE or not- the other changes are possibly acceptable/explainable. It's the FACES that really feel the most jarringly UnSliver-like.
posts.html:
As long as Uncommon exists, there's no reason to get rid of Mythic Rarity. As long as we want Draft to be a format, there's no reason to have any problem with the current Rarity structure.


However, I'm just saying that if we repealed Draft as a Format and made every card Common, Constructed would be a lot happier. :P

Also this looks like it's got a Sliver head. :)

I'm going to have a LOT to say about various Sliver artworks for M14, but ultimately- it makes a big difference whether you've got a FACE or not- the other changes are possibly acceptable/explainable. It's the FACES that really feel the most jarringly UnSliver-like.

Posted By: Sironos (5/27/2010 12:21:24 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I haven't played with or against a fungus deck, but I still wonder about this card's playability. If It was lower on the curve, then it could find a home at say 3 mana for a 1/1 or 2/2. Instead it competes with [Mycoloth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mycoloth) for the 5cmc slot. Yes, this is green, and green does mana ramp well, but how many spaces do you have for support cards just to get this one card to work? [Sporesower Thallid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sporesower Thallid) fits the curve much better.
  
   
@Wormfang: No. The "Sporoloth Ancient" on the card just meanss "this ability puts a counter on this card." This goes for any card with its cardname in the text, it only means it is refering to itself. Each turn your fungi are only getting 1 spore counter, unless you're using [Sporesower Thallid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sporesower Thallid), [Thelon of Havenwood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thelon of Havenwood), any of the numerous proliferate spells, or the quite expensive [Doubling Season](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doubling Season).
posts.html:
I haven't played with or against a fungus deck, but I still wonder about this card's playability. If It was lower on the curve, then it could find a home at say 3 mana for a 1/1 or 2/2. Instead it competes with Mycoloth for the 5cmc slot. Yes, this is green, and green does mana ramp well, but how many spaces do you have for support cards just to get this one card to work? Sporesower Thallid fits the curve much better.

@Wormfang: No. The "Sporoloth Ancient" on the card just meanss "this ability puts a counter on this card." This goes for any card with its cardname in the text, it only means it is refering to itself. Each turn your fungi are only getting 1 spore counter, unless you're using Sporesower Thallid, Thelon of Havenwood, any of the numerous proliferate spells, or the quite expensive Doubling Season.
